intro: Tricostularia fimbristyloides, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually hairy, giving it its common name, and it produces small, yellow or white flowers that bloom in spring. The species is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient and hardy plant.
